items.label: Creating a Configuration From a Template
Executing a Configuration with an Agent
Executing a Template with an Agent

accessing-the-integration-manager.title: Accessing the Integration Manager
accessing-the-integration-manager.description: The first time you log in to Integration Manager as an administrator, you will use the default administrator login username and password (admin/admin). We strongly recommended that you change the admin password. Refer to Editing Your Profile.

common-tasks.title: Common Tasks
common-tasks.description: Links to common tasks in Integration Manager are listed below.

copyright.title: Copyright Information
copyright.description: Copyright Â© 2025 Actian Corporation. All Rights Reserved.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: The Dashboard provides data visualization charts that you can use to monitor the overall status of your integrations, configurations, and agents.

editing-your-profile.title: Editing Your Profile
editing-your-profile.description: The My Profile page enables you to set the password you use to login to the Actian platform and to authenticate for direct API access.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: This page is a work in progress that aims to answer some of the most commonly-asked questions about the Actian Integration Platform. Your feedback will greatly help us identify areas in the product and documentation that need attention, and which questions we will add to this page.

feedback.title: Feedback and Support
feedback.description: We welcome and encourage your feedback on the platform and documentation. Feedback from the user community plays an important role in improving the product.

integration-agent/advanced-topics/config.title: Configuration Files
integration-agent/advanced-topics/config.description: Most Agent properties are set automatically and do not require maintenance or modification. In some cases, the default settings must be changed for various environment-specific reasons or corporate protocols. This section is a reference for making such changes, if required.

integration-agent/advanced-topics/connec.title: Connecting to Other Environments
integration-agent/advanced-topics/connec.description: If you need to connect to a non-production or VPC environment, follow the instructions below.

integration-agent/advanced-topics/manual.title: Manual Agent Registration
integration-agent/advanced-topics/manual.description: If you are having issues starting or registering a new or existing Agent installation, you can use Manual Agent Registration.

integration-agent/advanced-topics/retrie.title: Retrieve Agent Credential
integration-agent/advanced-topics/retrie.description: If you have an agent that is already registered, you can manually retrieve its credential to repair the installation.

integration-agent/advanced-topics/script.title: Scriptable Agent Registration
integration-agent/advanced-topics/script.description: If you need to automate Agent configuration and registration tasks (i.e. direct user interaction with the Agent is not possible), you can use silent install and Scriptable Agent Registration.

integration-agent/agent-overview.title: Integration Agent Overview
integration-agent/agent-overview.description: The INTEGRATION AGENT section contains information specific to the Agent itself, including installation and registration, on-premise data, and other more advanced topics. Details on managing agents from the Integration Manager (cloud or on-premise) are described in the INTEGRATION MANAGER USERS section. See Managing Agents and Devices.

integration-agent/monitoring-agent-statu.title: Monitoring Agent Status
integration-agent/monitoring-agent-statu.description: From the Agents tab in Integration Manager, you can:

integration-agent/on-prem-data/accessing.title: Accessing On-Premise Storage
integration-agent/on-prem-data/accessing.description: A common scenario for using DataCloud Agent to execute an integration is when you need to read or write a file stored either locally or on a network.

integration-agent/on-prem-data/connectin.title: Connecting to MS SQL Server
integration-agent/on-prem-data/connectin.description: On Windows, the Agent runs using the Windows Local System account by default. This may or may not be sufficient, depending on your business' security protocols.

integration-agent/run-your-first-remote-.title: Run Your First Remote Job
integration-agent/run-your-first-remote-.description: 1. Select the Configurations tab and click .

integration-manager/admin/access-control.title: Access Control Policies
integration-manager/admin/access-control.description: By default, non-admin users only have access to JobTemplates and JobConfigs they create. You can grant additional privileges and share artifacts across users by using Access Control Policies.

integration-manager/admin/access-control.title: User Management
integration-manager/admin/access-control.description: Administrators can create and manage users within the Administration Console. Note that User Management requires Account admin access.

integration-manager/admin/admin-overview.title: Integration Manager Administration Guide
integration-manager/admin/admin-overview.description: This section describes tasks performed by Integration Manager administrators, including access control, server administration, workload management, and configuration of security, DataFlow jobs, APIs, and listeners.

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: DataConnect Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available DataConnect properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: DataFlow Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available DataFlow properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: Datasource Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available Datasource properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: File Repository Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available File Repository properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: Application Property Reference
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: The application.properties file can be used for a variety of configurations to tailor Integration Manager to your requirements and environment. Refer to the following topics:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: Queue Connection Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available Queue Connection properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: Web Server Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available Web Server properties:

integration-manager/admin/application-pr.title: Worker Properties
integration-manager/admin/application-pr.description: Refer to the following table for available Worker properties:

integration-manager/admin/managing-job-e.title: Managing Job Execution History
integration-manager/admin/managing-job-e.description: You can control the amount of job history that Integration Manager maintains by date, volume, or both, depending on your needs.

integration-manager/admin/security/acces.title: Configuring Access Token Signatures
integration-manager/admin/security/acces.description: 1. Create a new keystore with keypair to be used for token signatures:

integration-manager/admin/security/enabl.title: Enabling HTTPS
integration-manager/admin/security/enabl.description: Using HTTPS is always recommended. Otherwise, API tokens, credentials, and payloads are subject to hijack.

integration-manager/admin/security/encry.title: Encryption-at-Rest
integration-manager/admin/security/encry.description: Macro values often contain sensitive data. To prevent exposure, it is best practice to encrypt these values at rest, meaning at the database level.

integration-manager/admin/security/encry.title: Encryption Keystores
integration-manager/admin/security/encry.description: An encryption keystore is required for the following:

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: AWS S3 Bucket Listener
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The AWS S3 Bucket Listener monitors S3 buckets for files and will execute a pre-defined Job Configuration (config-id) when triggered.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Azure Blob Storage Listener
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The Azure Blob Storage Listener monitors Blob containers for files and will execute a pre-defined Job Configuration (config-id) when triggered.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: File Folder Listener Service
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The File Folder Listener Service is used to monitor file directories or cloud storage buckets/containers for new files.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Google Cloud Storage Listener
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The Google Cloud Storage Listener monitors Google Storage buckets for files and will execute a pre-defined Job Configuration (config-id) when triggered.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Local Folder Listener
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The Local Folder Listener monitors file folders for files and will execute a pre-defined Job Configuration (config-id) when triggered.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Integration Engines
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: Integration Manager has the capability to leverage different Actian Integration Engines to execute jobs, depending on the use case. Generally, Integration Manager will install the latest GA patch of any supported Integration Engine as of the release date. It is recommended that you first update to the latest Integration Manager version before manually patching an Integration Engine.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Production Architecture
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: The following are high-level recommendations only. Actual production deployments should be examined for many other factors, including but not limited to desired workload.

integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.title: Actian Integration Manager Worker
integration-manager/admin/server-adminis.description: This section describes how to install, configure, and use the Actian Integration Manager Worker.

integration-manager/admin/setup-job-noti.title: Configuring Job Notifications
integration-manager/admin/setup-job-noti.description: Integration Manager has the capability of sending email notifications for certain job completion events (not currently available for DataCloud SaaS accounts).

integration-manager/agents-and-devices/d.title: Downloading Integration Agent
integration-manager/agents-and-devices/d.description: You can download the installer from the Agents and Devices page:

integration-manager/agents-and-devices/e.title: Executing a Configuration with an Agent
integration-manager/agents-and-devices/e.description: To set a configuration to execute using an agent:

integration-manager/agents-and-devices/e.title: Executing a Template with an Agent
integration-manager/agents-and-devices/e.description: To set a template to execute using an agent:

integration-manager/agents-and-devices/m.title: Managing Agents and Devices
integration-manager/agents-and-devices/m.description: The Agents and Devices page in Integration Manager provides a list of registered Agents and the ability to manage your Agents.

integration-manager/agents-and-devices/o.title: Other Authorized Devices
integration-manager/agents-and-devices/o.description: The Other Authorized Devices list is visible to administrators. Items listed are typically file folder listeners, but can be anything that has been set up via Device Flow.

integration-manager/APIs/jobconfig-expor.title: JobConfig/JobTemplate Export/Import API
integration-manager/APIs/jobconfig-expor.description: This service allows an API consumer to export packages and configurations from an on-prem installation of Integration Manager and import them to the cloud, enabling you to easily migrate between deployments.

integration-manager/APIs/quickstart-api-.title: Quick Start API Tutorial
integration-manager/APIs/quickstart-api-.description: Integration Manager is an entirely API-driven platform. Every function available via the UI is also available as an API (and more!).

integration-manager/configurations/activ.title: Activating or Inactivating Configurations
integration-manager/configurations/activ.description: In order to run a configuration, its status must be Active. Setting the configuration status to Inactive allows you to disable the configuration without deleting it. You can reactivate it later when needed by setting the status back to Active.

integration-manager/configurations/confi.title: Configurations Overview
integration-manager/configurations/confi.description: A configuration is a set of properties and parameters that specify when, where, and how an integration will be executed. Configurations contain references to a specific integration, the location in which the integration will be executed, and the frequency at which executions will occur.

integration-manager/configurations/creat.title: Creating Configuration Macros
integration-manager/configurations/creat.description: Configuration macros can be viewed by any user who has at least read access to the configuration. They can only be created, edited, and deleted by users with write access to the configuration, by the configuration owner, or by account admin users.

integration-manager/configurations/delet.title: Deleting Configurations
integration-manager/configurations/delet.description: You can delete an existing configuration from several different pages.

integration-manager/configurations/dupli.title: Duplicating Configurations
integration-manager/configurations/dupli.description: If you need an integration that is very similar to an existing integration, consider duplicating the existing integration and revising it, rather than creating one from scratch.

integration-manager/configurations/editi.title: Editing Configuration Schedules
integration-manager/configurations/editi.description: Integration Manager supports both Interval and Cron expression scheduling. The powerful Quartz scheduler engine is used to manage scheduling and schedule triggers.

integration-manager/configurations/inact.title: Inactivating Configurations
integration-manager/configurations/inact.description: Setting the configuration status to Inactive allows you to disable the configuration without deleting it. You can reactivate it later when needed by setting the status back to Active.

integration-manager/configurations/manag.title: Managing Configuration Files
integration-manager/configurations/manag.description: You can upload files for use with your configurations. These can be public files or private files.

integration-manager/configurations/run-y.title: Run Your First Job
integration-manager/configurations/run-y.description: JG Feedback - Initially I thought this should be moved to the 'Jobs' section but it looks like it should be combined with the other doc 'creating-configurations.md'. Each of these doc files contains essential info for creating configurations.

integration-manager/configurations/runni.title: Running Configurations
integration-manager/configurations/runni.description: Configurations can be run manually or on a schedule. An integration is executed when you run an associated configuration. When completed, runtime metrics will be available for review.

integration-manager/file-listener/file-l.title: File Listener History & Backup Configuration
integration-manager/file-listener/file-l.description: All processed and unprocessed file history can be managed with camel routes.

integration-manager/files/managing-files.title: Managing Files
integration-manager/files/managing-files.description: You can upload and manage files for use with your configurations and templates. These can be private files or public files.

integration-manager/jobs/downloading-the.title: Downloading the Log File
integration-manager/jobs/downloading-the.description: To download a log file for a specific job:

integration-manager/jobs/subscribing-to-.title: Subscribing to Job Notifications
integration-manager/jobs/subscribing-to-.description: Job notifications must be enabled and configured by an admin. See Configuring Job Notifications.

integration-manager/jobs/viewing-job-run.title: Viewing Job Run History
integration-manager/jobs/viewing-job-run.description: You can view job run history for recent jobs, all jobs, or a specific job.

integration-manager/macros/creating-macr.title: Creating Macros
integration-manager/macros/creating-macr.description: This topic describes the process of manually creating a macro. For details on importing macros, see Importing Macros.

integration-manager/macros/editing-macro.title: Editing Macros
integration-manager/macros/editing-macro.description: Only admin users can edit Public macros.

integration-manager/macros/importing-mac.title: Importing Macros
integration-manager/macros/importing-mac.description: Importing macros by uploading a macro definition file (see Macro File Examples) allows you to upload multiple macros without having to manually define each macro.

integration-manager/macros/macros-overvi.title: Macros Overview
integration-manager/macros/macros-overvi.description: Macros enable you to run a single integration for different types of users without having to modify the integration itself. Macros are defined when the integration is in the configuration state. Macros can save you time and reduce errors at runtime.

integration-manager/macros/securing-macr.title: Securing Macros
integration-manager/macros/securing-macr.description: You can permanently encrypt macro values by using the Secure flag. Once a macro is flagged as secure, it can never be read outside of the integration engine runtime.

integration-manager/macros/using-LOCAL_J.title: Using LOCAL_JOB_SPEC_DIR
integration-manager/macros/using-LOCAL_J.description: The macro LOCALJOBSPEC_DIR is automatically configured for your jobs running in Integration Manager. It will be automatically populated with the location to which additional files are downloaded when your job runs.

integration-manager/macros/using-preinst.title: Using Pre-Installed Driver Macros
integration-manager/macros/using-preinst.description: Integration Manager provides pre-installed JDBC drivers from different vendors. You can use those drivers by specifying the supported macros listed below for each driver type.

integration-manager/manager-overview.title: Integration Manager User Guide
integration-manager/manager-overview.description: This section describes how to use Actian Integration Manager, an elastic cloud-based platform that enables the design, deployment, and management of web-based integrations.

integration-manager/templates/activating.title: Activating or Inactivating Templates
integration-manager/templates/activating.description: Setting a template to Inactive not only inactivates the template but will also inactivate any configurations based on it.

integration-manager/templates/creating-a.title: Creating a Configuration From a Template
integration-manager/templates/creating-a.description: To create a configuration from a template:

integration-manager/templates/creating-t.title: Creating Templates
integration-manager/templates/creating-t.description: Templates contain integration settings that are reusable by linked configurations. Templates include a package, macros, and a location to execute the job.

integration-manager/templates/managing-t.title: Managing Template Configurations
integration-manager/templates/managing-t.description: Templates can be linked to a Configuration to reuse integration packages and other runtime settings automatically.

integration-manager/templates/managing-t.title: Managing Template Files
integration-manager/templates/managing-t.description: You can upload files for use with your templates. These can be public files or private files.

intro.title: Actian Integration Platform
intro.description: Established in 2008, and architected with a cloud-first imperative, the Actian DataCloud platform has unleashed its power to all manners of deployment, including SaaS, on-premise, and private cloud.

release-notes.title: Release Notes
release-notes.description: Documentation for Integration Platform releases prior to version 3.2 has not been migrated to this new documentation platform.
